instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> arrived with water damage on backlight circuit and <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>. Rest of board was spotless. Replaced <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and two capacitors that were affected by the spill but board still does not power on. <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> were spotless but still reflowed them to rule out. PPDCIN only 0.35V on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>  but <RESISTOR>R9920</RESISTOR> is 5.20v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message: Start checking diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>, F7000 and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> .347  F7000 .358 <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> .360

Replaced both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> from donar but no change. Yes, matched it with other C00

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
That means you have <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.
That requires at least 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Did it appear after changed the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips?
Any other signal change?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
No everything remained the same after changed <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> 

what should I check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
There is something strange.
As per schematic, <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> power supply gets input voltage BEHIND <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Also <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> enables <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message: What should I try next then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
Post accurate information.
Re-check all your measurments.
Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 5V"
Are you sure?
Should be 3V.

"Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> chip."
VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
When replacing cd3215s I used 0.30mm solder balls instead of 0.25 from donar. Could that alone cause a issue? Have new ones on the way.

Yes <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> measures 5.10V on <RESISTOR>R6991</RESISTOR>. Checked again.

VDDA/P 5.10V

<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 1.294V

<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> 3.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 1.294V"
So you have 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>!!!

"VDDA/P 5.10V"
This is also impossible without that voltage.

Please be sure to make good contact when you measure something on the board.

Also be sure <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips are properly soldered.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on
threads.message:
Both CD3215s have been replaced with new ones and still stuck at 5.20V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V

Can anything cause it to be stuck at 5.20V??
